section.title: Introduction
section.p: The area of a region in the plane bounded above by f(x) and below by g(x) for x values between a and b is given by \int_a^b f(x) - g(x) \; dx It's usually helpful to look at a graph to get a better sense of the situation.

introduction.p: Determine the area of the regions enclosed by the curves listed below. Draw a picture for each one.

activity.task: y=x^2, y=8-x^2, in the first quadrant. (Hint: use symmetry.)
y=\sqrt{x}, y=2\sqrt{x}, x=4 (Hint: use the last two.)
y=\cos(\pi x / 2), y= 1-x^2, in the first quadrant. Explain how, without graphing, you could determine which of the two curves is "on top."
y=x, y=\sqrt{x}, y=4 (Hint: turn your head sideways.)
y=\ln(x), y=0, x=e, but with your head sideways (unless that's what you did the first time, in which case do it with your head upright).
